devdoc.author: Haberdasher Labs
devdoc.details: This is a multi-tenant contract that can manage all hats for a given chain. While it fully implements the ERC1155 interface, it does not fully comply with the ERC1155 standard.

InvalidUnlink().details: This ensures that unlinking never results in a bricked tophat

NotAdmin(address,uint256).details: Can be equivalent to `NotHatWearer(buildHatId(hatId))`, such as when emitted by `approveLinkTopHatToTree` or `relinkTopHatToTree`

StringTooLong().details: This protects against a DOS attack where an admin iteratively extend's a hat's details or imageURI      to be so long that reading it exceeds the block gas limit, breaking `uri()` and `viewHat()`

params.eligibility: The address that can report on the Hat wearer's status
params.id: The id for the new hat
params.imageURI: The image uri for this hat and the fallback for its
params.maxSupply: The total instances of the Hat that can be worn at once
params.mutable_: Whether the hat's properties are changeable after creation
params.toggle: The address that can deactivate the Hat

params.domain: The domain of the tree tophat to link
params.newAdmin: The tophat's would-be admin in the parent tree

params.domain: The domain of the newly-linked tophat
params.newAdmin: The tophat's new admin in the parent tree

WearerStandingChanged(uint256,address,bo.details: Eligibility is excluded since the source of truth for eligibility is the eligibility module and may change without a transaction

params.hatId: The id of the wearer's hat
params.wearerStanding: Whether the wearer is in good standing for the hat

approveLinkTopHatToTree(uint32,uint256,a.details: Requests can only be approved by wearer or an admin of the `_newAdminHat`, and there      can only be one link per tree root at a given time.

params._details: Optional new details for the linked topHat
params._eligibility: Optional new eligibility module for the linked topHat
params._imageURI: Optional new imageURI for the linked topHat
params._newAdminHat: The hat that will administer the linked tree
params._toggle: Optional new toggle module for the linked topHat
params._topHatDomain: The 32 bit domain of the topHat to link

balanceOf(address,uint256).details: Balance is dynamic based on the hat's status and wearer's eligibility, so off-chain balance data indexed from events may not be in sync

params._hatId: The id of the Hat
params._wearer: The address whose balance is being checked

returns.balance: The `wearer`'s balance of the Hat tokens. Can never be > 1.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: Given the higher gas overhead of Hats balanceOf checks, large batches may be high cost or run into gas limits

params._hatIds: Array of Hat ids to check, using the same index as _wearers
params._wearers: Array of addresses to check balances for

batchCreateHats(uint256[],string[],uint3.details: This is a convenience function that loops through the arrays and calls `createHat`.

params._admins: Array of ids of admins for each hat to create
params._details: Array of details for each hat to create
params._eligibilityModules: Array of eligibility module addresses for each hat to create
params._imageURIs: Array of imageURIs for each hat to create
params._maxSupplies: Array of supply caps for each hat to create
params._mutables: Array of mutable flags for each hat to create
params._toggleModules: Array of toggle module addresses for each hat to create

returns.success: True if all createHat calls succeeded

batchMintHats(uint256[],address[]).details: This is a convenience function that loops through the arrays and calls `mintHat`.

params._hatIds: Array of ids of hats to mint
params._wearers: Array of addresses to which the hats will be minted

returns.success: True if all mintHat calls succeeded

buildHatId(uint256,uint16).details: Reverts if the admin has already reached `MAX_LEVELS`

params._admin: the id of the admin for the new hat
params._newHat: the uint16 id of the new hat

changeHatDetails(uint256,string).details: Hat must be mutable, except for tophats.

params._hatId: The id of the Hat to change
params._newDetails: The new details. Must not be larger than 7000 bytes.

params._hatId: The id of the Hat to change

changeHatImageURI(uint256,string).details: Hat must be mutable, except for tophats

params._hatId: The id of the Hat to change
params._newImageURI: The new imageURI. Must not be larger than 7000 bytes.

changeHatMaxSupply(uint256,uint32).details: Hat must be mutable; new max supply cannot be less than current supply

params._hatId: The id of the Hat to change
The id of the Hat to change

checkHatStatus(uint256).details: May change the hat's status in storage

params._hatId: The id of the Hat whose toggle we are checking

returns.toggled: Whether there was a new status

checkHatWearerStatus(uint256,address).details: Burns the wearer's hat, if revoked

params._hatId: The id of the hat
params._wearer: The address of the Hat wearer whose status report is being requested

returns.updated: Whether the wearer's status was altered

params._name: The name of this contract, typically including the version

createHat(uint256,string,uint32,address,.details: Initializes a new Hat struct, but does not mint any tokens.

params._admin: The id of the Hat that will control who wears the newly created hat
params._details: A description of the Hat. Should not be larger than 7000 bytes (enforced in changeHatDetails)
params._eligibility: The address that can report on the Hat wearer's status
params._imageURI: The image uri for this hat and the fallback for its                  downstream hats [optional]. Should not be larger than 7000 bytes (enforced in changeHatImageURI)
params._maxSupply: The total instances of the Hat that can be worn at once
params._mutable: Whether the hat's properties are changeable after creation
params._toggle: The address that can deactivate the Hat

returns.newHatId: The id of the newly created Hat

getAdminAtLevel(uint256,uint32).details: This function traverses trees by following the linkedTreeAdmin       pointer to a hat located in a different tree

params._hatId: the id of the hat in question

returns.admin: The hat id of the resulting admin

params._hatId: the id of the hat in question

returns.admin: The hat id of the resulting admin

params._hatId: The hat whose eligibility module we're looking for

returns.eligibility: The eligibility module for this hat

params._hatId: the id of the hat in question
The hat whose max supply we're looking for

returns.maxSupply: The maximum possible quantity of this hat that could be minted

params._hatId: The hat whose toggle module we're looking for

returns.toggle: The toggle module for this hat

getImageURIForHat(uint256).details: If this hat does not have an imageURI set, recursively get the imageURI from      its admin

params._hatId: The hat whose imageURI we're looking for

returns._uri: The imageURI of this hat or, if empty, its admin

getLocalHatLevel(uint256).details: Similar to getHatLevel, but does not account for linked trees

params._hatId: the id of the hat in question

params._admin: The id of the hat to serve as the admin for the next child hat

params._topHatDomain: the 32 bit domain of a (likely linked) tophat

getTopHatDomain(uint256).details: A domain is the identifier for a given hat tree, stored in the first 4 bytes of a hat's id

params._hatId: the id of the hat in question

returns.domain: The domain of the hat's tophat

hatSupply(uint256).details: Only tracks explicit burns and mints, not dynamic revocations

params._hatId: The id of the Hat

returns.supply: The current supply of the Hat

params._hatId: The id of the hat

isAdminOfHat(address,uint256).details: Recursively checks if `_user` wears the admin Hat of the Hat in question. This is recursive since there may be a string of Hats as admins of Hats.

params._hatId: The id of the Hat for which the `_user` might be the admin

returns.isAdmin: Whether the `_user` has admin rights for the Hat

isEligible(address,uint256).details: Public function for use when passing a Hat object is not possible or preferable

params._hatId: The id of the Hat

returns.eligible: Whether the wearer is eligible for the Hat

params._hatId: The id of the Hat
params._wearer: The address of the Hat wearer

returns.standing: Whether the wearer is in good standing

isLocalTopHat(uint256).details: Similar to isTopHat, but does not account for linked trees

params._hatId: The hat in question

returns._isLocalTopHat: Whether the hat is a topHat for its local tree

params._hatId: The hat in question

returns._isTopHat: Whether the hat is a topHat

params._hatId: The id of the Hat that the `_user` might wear

makeHatImmutable(uint256).details: Sets the second bit of hat.config to 0

params._hatId: The id of the Hat to make immutable

mintHat(uint256,address).details: The msg.sender must wear an admin Hat of `_hatId`, and the recipient must be eligible to wear `_hatId`

params._hatId: The id of the Hat to mint
params._wearer: The address to which the Hat is minted

mintTopHat(address,string,string).details: A topHat has no eligibility and no toggle

params._details: A description of the Hat [optional]. Should not be larger than 7000 bytes                 (enforced in changeHatDetails)
params._imageURI: The image uri for this top hat and the fallback for its                  downstream hats [optional]. Should not be large than 7000 bytes                  (enforced in changeHatImageURI)
params._target: The address to which the newly created topHat is minted

returns.topHatId: The id of the newly created topHat

multicall(bytes[]).details: Apply `DELEGATECALL` with the current contract to each calldata in `data`, and store the `abi.encode` formatted results of each `DELEGATECALL` into `results`. If any of the `DELEGATECALL`s reverts, the entire context is reverted, and the error is bubbled up. This function is deliberately made non-payable to guard against double-spending. (See: https://www.paradigm.xyz/2021/08/two-rights-might-make-a-wrong) For efficiency, this function will directly return the results, terminating the context. If called internally, it must be called at the end of a function that returns `(bytes[] memory)`.

params._linkedAdmin: the hatId of the potential tree admin
params._topHatDomain: the 32 bit domain of the tree to be linked

returns.notCircular: circular link has not been found

relinkTopHatWithinTree(uint32,uint256,ad.details: Caller must be both an admin tree root and admin or wearer of `_newAdminHat`.

params._details: Optional new details for the linked topHat
params._eligibility: Optional new eligibility module for the linked topHat
params._imageURI: Optional new imageURI for the linked topHat
params._newAdminHat: The new admin for the linked tree
params._toggle: Optional new toggle module for the linked topHat
params._topHatDomain: The 32 bit domain of the topHat to relink

params._hatId: The id of the Hat being renounced

requestLinkTopHatToTree(uint32,uint256).details: A topHat can have at most 1 request at a time. Submitting a new request will      replace the existing request.

params._requestedAdminHat: The hat that will administer the linked tree
params._topHatDomain: The domain of the topHat to link

params._newAdminHat: The new admin for the linked tree
params._topHatDomain: The 32 bit domain of the tophat to be linked

returns.sameDomain: Whether the _topHatDomain and the domain of its potential linked _newAdminHat domains are the same

setHatStatus(uint256,bool).details: The msg.sender must be set as the hat's toggle

params._hatId: The id of the Hat for which to adjust status

setHatWearerStatus(uint256,address,bool,.details: Burns the wearer's hat, if revoked

params._eligible: Whether the wearer is eligible for the hat (will be revoked if false)
params._hatId: The id of the hat
params._standing: False if the wearer is no longer in good standing (and potentially should be penalized)
params._wearer: The address of the hat wearer whose status is being reported

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: While Hats Protocol conforms to the ERC1155 *interface*, it does not fully conform to the ERC1155 *specification*  since it does not implement the ERC1155Receiver functionality.  For this reason, this function overrides the ERC1155 implementation to return false for ERC1155.

params.interfaceId: The interface identifier, as specified in ERC-165

returns._0: bool True if the contract implements `interfaceId` and false otherwise

transferHat(uint256,address,address).details: The hat must be mutable, and the transfer must be initiated by an admin

params._hatId: The hat in question

unlinkTopHatFromTree(uint32,address).details: This can only be called by an admin of the tree root. Fails if the topHat to unlink has no non-zero wearer, which can occur if...     - It's wearer is in badStanding     - It has been revoked from its wearer (and possibly burned)     - It is not active (ie toggled off)

params._topHatDomain: The 32 bit domain of the topHat to unlink
params._wearer: The current wearer of the topHat to unlink

params._hatId: The id of the Hat

returns.active: Whether the Hat is current active, as read from `_isActive`
returns.eligibility: The eligibility address for this Hat
returns.imageURI: The image URI used for this Hat
returns.lastHatId: The most recently created Hat with this Hat as admin; also the count of Hats with this Hat as admin
returns.maxSupply: The max supply of tokens for this Hat
returns.mutable_: Whether this hat's properties can be changed
returns.supply: The number of current wearers of this Hat
returns.toggle: The toggle address for this Hat

_hats.details: Internal mapping of hats to hat ids. See HatsIdUtilities.sol for more info on how hat ids work

badStandings.details: Used by external contracts to trigger penalties for wearers in bad standing      hatId => wearer => !standing

devdoc.title: Hats Protocol v1

AllHatsWorn(uint256).notice: Emitted when attempting to mint `hatId` but `hatId`'s maxSupply has been reached

AlreadyWearingHat(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when attempting to mint `hatId` to a `wearer` who is already wearing the hat

BatchArrayLengthMismatch().notice: Emitted when array arguments to a batch function have mismatching lengths

CircularLinkage().notice: Emitted when attempting to link a tophat to a new admin for which the tophat serves as an admin

CrossTreeLinkage().notice: Emitted when attempting to link or relink a tophat to a separate tree

HatDoesNotExist(uint256).notice: Emitted when attempting to mint a non-existant hat

HatNotActive().notice: Emmitted when attempting to mint or transfer a hat that is not active

Immutable().notice: Emitted when attempting to mutate or transfer an immutable hat

InvalidHatId().notice: Emitted when an attempted hat id has empty intermediate level(s)

InvalidUnlink().notice: Emitted when attempting to unlink a tophat that does not have a wearer

LinkageNotRequested().notice: Emitted when attempting to link a tophat without a request

MaxLevelsReached().notice: Emitted when attempting to create a hat with a level 14 hat as its admin

NewMaxSupplyTooLow().notice: Emitted when attempting to change a hat's maxSupply to a value lower than its current supply

NotAdmin(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when `user` is attempting to perform an action on `hatId` but is not wearing one of `hatId`'s admin hats

NotAdminOrWearer().notice: Emitted when attempting to perform an action that requires being either an admin or wearer of a given hat

NotEligible().notice: Emitted when attempting to mint or transfer a hat to an ineligible wearer

NotHatWearer().notice: Emitted when attempting to perform an action as or for an account that is not a wearer of a given hat

NotHatsEligibility().notice: Emitted when attempting to check or set a hat wearer's status from an account that is not that hat's eligibility module

NotHatsToggle().notice: Emitted when attempting to check or set a hat's status from an account that is not that hat's toggle module

StringTooLong().notice: Emmitted when attempting to change a hat's details or imageURI to a string with over 7000 bytes (~characters)

ZeroAddress().notice: Emmited when attempting to change a hat's eligibility or toggle module to the zero address

HatCreated(uint256,string,uint32,address.notice: Emitted when a new hat is created

HatDetailsChanged(uint256,string).notice: Emitted when a hat's details are updated

HatEligibilityChanged(uint256,address).notice: Emitted when a hat's eligibility module is updated

HatImageURIChanged(uint256,string).notice: Emitted when a hat's image URI is updated

HatMaxSupplyChanged(uint256,uint32).notice: Emitted when a hat's maximum supply is updated

HatMutabilityChanged(uint256).notice: Emitted when a hat's mutability is updated

HatStatusChanged(uint256,bool).notice: Emitted when a hat's status is updated

HatToggleChanged(uint256,address).notice: Emitted when a hat's toggle module is updated

TopHatLinkRequested(uint32,uint256).notice: Emitted when a tophat linkage is requested by its admin

TopHatLinked(uint32,uint256).notice: Emitted when a tophat is linked to a another tree

WearerStandingChanged(uint256,address,bo.notice: Emitted when a hat wearer's standing is updated

approveLinkTopHatToTree(uint32,uint256,a.notice: Approve a request to link a Tree under a parent tree, with options to add eligibility or toggle modules and change its metadata

badStandings(uint256,address).notice: Mapping of wearers in bad standing for certain hats

balanceOf(address,uint256).notice: Gets the Hat token balance of a user for a given Hat

baseImageURI().notice: The fallback image URI for hat tokens with no `imageURI` specified in their branch

batchCreateHats(uint256[],string[],uint3.notice: Creates new hats in batch. The msg.sender must be an admin of each hat.

batchMintHats(uint256[],address[]).notice: Mints new hats in batch. The msg.sender must be an admin of each hat.

buildHatId(uint256,uint16).notice: Constructs a valid hat id for a new hat underneath a given admin

checkHatStatus(uint256).notice: Checks a hat's toggle module and processes the returned status

checkHatWearerStatus(uint256,address).notice: Check a hat's eligibility for a report on the status of one of the hat's wearers and, if `false`, revoke their hat

constructor.notice: All arguments are immutable; they can only be set once during construction

createHat(uint256,string,uint32,address,.notice: Creates a new hat. The msg.sender must wear the `_admin` hat.

getAdminAtLevel(uint256,uint32).notice: Gets the hat id of the admin at a given level of a given hat

getAdminAtLocalLevel(uint256,uint32).notice: Gets the hat id of the admin at a given level of a given hat         local to the tree containing the hat.

getHatEligibilityModule(uint256).notice: Gets the eligibility module for a hat

getHatLevel(uint256).notice: Identifies the level a given hat in its hat tree

getHatMaxSupply(uint256).notice: Gets the max supply for a hat

getHatToggleModule(uint256).notice: Gets the toggle module for a hat

getImageURIForHat(uint256).notice: Gets the imageURI for a given hat

getLocalHatLevel(uint256).notice: Identifies the level a given hat in its local hat tree

getNextId(uint256).notice: Gets the id of the next child hat of the hat `_admin`

getTippyTopHatDomain(uint32).notice: Gets the domain of the highest parent tophat  the "tippy tophat"

getTopHatDomain(uint256).notice: Gets the tophat domain of a given hat

hatSupply(uint256).notice: Gets the current supply of a Hat

isActive(uint256).notice: Checks the active status of a hat

isAdminOfHat(address,uint256).notice: Checks whether a given address serves as the admin of a given Hat

isEligible(address,uint256).notice: Checks whether an address is eligible for a given Hat

isInGoodStanding(address,uint256).notice: Checks whether a wearer of a Hat is in good standing

isLocalTopHat(uint256).notice: Checks whether a hat is a topHat in its local hat tree

isTopHat(uint256).notice: Checks whether a hat is a topHat

isWearerOfHat(address,uint256).notice: Checks whether a given address wears a given Hat

lastTopHatId().notice: The first 4 bytes of the id of the last tophat created.

linkedTreeAdmins(uint32).notice: Mapping of approved & linked tophats to admin hats in other trees, used for grafting one hats tree onto another

linkedTreeRequests(uint32).notice: Mapping of tophats requesting to link to admin hats in other trees

makeHatImmutable(uint256).notice: Set a mutable hat to immutable

mintHat(uint256,address).notice: Mints an ERC1155-similar token of the Hat to an eligible recipient, who then "wears" the hat

mintTopHat(address,string,string).notice: Creates and mints a Hat that is its own admin, i.e. a "topHat"

name().notice: The name of the contract, typically including the version

noCircularLinkage(uint32,uint256).notice: Checks For any circular linkage of trees

relinkTopHatWithinTree(uint32,uint256,ad.notice: Move a tree root to a different position within the same parent tree,         without a request. Valid destinations include within the same local tree as the origin,         or to the local tree of the tippyTopHat. TippyTopHat wearers can bypass this restriction         to relink to anywhere in its full tree.

renounceHat(uint256).notice: Stop wearing a hat, aka "renounce" it

requestLinkTopHatToTree(uint32,uint256).notice: Submits a request to link a Hat Tree under a parent tree. Requests can be submitted by either...     a) the wearer of a topHat, previous to any linkage, or     b) the admin(s) of an already-linked topHat (aka tree root), where such a        request is to move the tree root to another admin within the same parent        tree

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.notice: Safe transfers are not necessary for Hats since transfers are not handled by the wearer

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.notice: Safe transfers are not necessary for Hats since transfers are not handled by the wearer

sameTippyTopHatDomain(uint32,uint256).notice: Checks that a tophat domain and its potential linked admin are from the same tree, ie have the same tippy tophat domain

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).notice: Approvals are not necessary for Hats since transfers are not handled by the wearer

setHatStatus(uint256,bool).notice: Toggles a Hat's status from active to deactive, or vice versa

setHatWearerStatus(uint256,address,bool,.notice: Report from a hat's eligibility on the status of one of its wearers and, if `false`, revoke their hat

transferHat(uint256,address,address).notice: Transfers a hat from one wearer to another eligible wearer

unlinkTopHatFromTree(uint32,address).notice: Unlink a Tree from the parent tree

uri(uint256).notice: View the uri for a Hat

viewHat(uint256).notice: View the properties of a given Hat

userdoc.notice: Hats are DAO-native, revocable, and programmable roles that are represented as non-transferable ERC-1155-similar tokens for composability
